comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: That gentleman on the right with the languid pose and the cigar was about to make rabbits ears for the lady in the light coloured dress!  The bounder!!!

comment.author: 77781944@N05
comment._content: William Tempest's wife Jane Emily Backhouse, had a sister Alice Gertrude Backhouse. She married Hewston Maxwell Williamson. Since this picture is in the Tempest collection, I would assume that this is a combined family picnic, hosted by the Williamson family. Hewston Maxwell Williamston seems to have been a been a merchant in Dundalk (his father was Thomas Williamson, Timber Merchant)

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/77781944@N05] Fantastically detailed genealogical information - thank you! So Thomas and Maxwell and Alice could very well be in this photo, and maybe Jane Tempest, née Backhouse too?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 77781944@N05
comment._content: Perhaps!! Sadly I don't know their faces, so couldn't tell. I do think that William Tempest may be the older gentleman on the family gatherings, outside (one for tea and another for lunch). You also have a picture of "father with Norah and Elizabeth". William had   daughter's named Norah Souttar Tempest and Mary Elizabeth Tempest, so more family members identified?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/77781944@N05] You are now our official Tempest expert-in-residence!
